lead_paragraph: Guns instead of compromises have filled the vacuum left by the fall of Col. Muammar el-Qaddafi, breaking the country into two warring coalitions.

headline.print_headline: As Libya Crumbles, Factions Get New Incentives to Meet Halfway
headline.main: As Libya Crumbles, Calls Grow for Feuding Factions to Meet Halfway

snippet: Guns instead of compromises have filled the vacuum left by the fall of Col. Muammar el-Qaddafi, breaking the country into two warring coalitions.
abstract: Coalitions of militias and city-states that have been fighting for control of Libya since fall of Col Muammar el-Qaddafi may finally be ready to compromise; political leaders from both sides could join forces to avoid complete collapse of economy and to expel Islamic State militants who have taken control of two coastal cities.
